Company: CS Stars, subsidiary of insurance company Marsh Inc.
Description of incident: On May 9, CS Stars lost              track of a personal computer containing records of more than a half              million New Yorkers who made claims to a special workers' comp fund.              The lost data includes SSNs and date of birth but apparently no medical              information. UPDATE (7/26/06):             Computer was recovered. UPDATE             (04/26/07): The               New York Attorney General's office  found that CS Stars violated              the state's security breach law. CS Stars must pay the Attorney General's              office $60,000 for investigation costs. It was determined that the              computer had been stolen by an employee of a cleaning contractor,              the missing computer was located and recovered, and that the data              on the missing computer had not been improperly accessed.
